intro: Microlicia doryphylla var. cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved microlicia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are typically narrow and pointed. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. It is native to regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
